entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Johnson and southeastern Washington Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 729 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chilhowie, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued June 25 at 7:24PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR WEST CENTRAL SHENANDOAH AND CENTRAL HARDY COUNTIES WILL EXPIRE AT 730 PM EDT... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer poses an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 6:27PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Smyth. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued June 25 at 6:38PM AST until June 27 at 6:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected due to breaking waves of 5 to 8 feet. * WHERE...Eastern beaches of St. Croix. * WHEN...From Sunday evening through Monday afternoon.

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued June 25 at 10:35AM PDT until June 26 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Hot conditions with high temperatures in the mid to upper 80s. Overnight low temperatures will only likely cool into the low 60s for many locations Saturday night into Sunday morning. This will pose a moderate risk of heat-related illness. * WHERE...North Coast and Central Coast.

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued June 25 at 10:35AM PDT until June 27 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Hot conditions with high temperatures in the mid to upper 80s on Saturday, and low 90s on Sunday and Monday. Overnight low temperatures will likely only cool into the low 60s for many locations Saturday night and again Sunday night. This will pose a moderate risk of heat-related illness.
